newsitem.title: USA: U.S. Spring/White Wheat - Spring bids edge higher.
newsitem.headline: U.S. Spring/White Wheat - Spring bids edge higher.

text.p: Dark northern spring wheat cash bids edged higher on Tuesday with gains tied to advances in MGE spring wheat futures and to concerns a wet summer would speed development of scab fungus, cash merchandisers said.

"Spring wheat had plenty of rain in North Dakota's Red River Valley region and there are concerns about scab," a Minnesota dealer said. The crop was due to be harvested in about three to four weeks in that region, he added.
A North Dakota merchandiser agreed that scab was a legitimate problem in the Red River Valley region where heavy rains were blamed for crop damage.
The wet conditions during the past few weeks prompted some disease pressure on the wheat crop, one Montana dealer said.

But further west in central and western Montana, crop conditions were improving and the winter wheat was expected to yield 30 to 40 bushels per acre, the dealer said. Low protein levels continued to be of concern.
Price per bushel for 14-pct protein dark northern spring, durum and white wheats, in dollars per bushel:
Spring Chg Durum(m) Chg White Chg
Spring Chg HRW 13pct Chg White Chg
